purpleculture_pinyin:
zuān
to drill; to bore; to get into; to make one's way into; to enter (a hole); to thread one's way through; to study intensively; to dig into; to curry favor for personal gain
сверлить; утомлять; чтобы попасть в; пробиться внутрь; войти (дыра); протиснуться сквозь него; интенсивно учиться; копаться; выслужиться ради личной выгоды

zuàn
an auger; diamond
шнек; алмаз
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 钻)
Pictophonetic: 贊 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鑽研 [ zuān yán ]: to study meticulously; to delve into
鑽探 [ zuān tàn ]: drilling
鑽營 [ zuān yíng ]: toadying for personal gain; to curry favor; to study in great depth
鑽心 [ zuān xīn ]: to sneak in; to infiltrate; to be piercingly painful; to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
鑽空子 [ zuān kòng zi ]: lit. to drill a hole; to take advantage of a loophole; to exploit an advantage; to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
鑽石 [ zuàn shí ]: diamond; Classifiers: 颗
鑽戒 [ zuàn jiè ]: diamond ring; Classifiers: 只
鑽頭 [ zuàn tóu ]: drill bit
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 贊 [ zàn ] to help, to support; to laud, to praise
heisig_chinese_memo: Drills can be metal lifesavers sometimes like when you have that nasty cavity that just won't stop aching.
Ru_trainchinese:
zuān: (глаг) сверлить, буравить; проходить через, проникать; активно изучать, штудировать; гнаться за личной выгодой, использовать в корыстных целях
zuàn: (сущ) бриллиант, драгоценный камень; бурильная установка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: there's agreement (贊) gold (金) won't make fire
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To tell fortunes, this fortune teller uses a metal drill to make a small invisible hole in the mind of her customer allowing her to see his mind clearly.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " gold ", " Like " sound. The original meaning is a tool for piercing. "Said Wen": "Drilling, so you can wear it. From gold, praise." Such as "Jijiu Pian" "Iron 鈇Drilling Cone Cauldron", Yan Shigu's Note: "Drilling, so you can pass through." Yuan. Positive Admonishment": "Taishan slips through the stone, and the rope is used for a long time. It is a wood. Water is not a stone for a drill, and a rope is not a saw for wood.

" Drill " also means perforation and piercing. Duan Yucai's note in "Shuowen": "This is the name of a device, because it is called a diamond." For example, "Mencius. "Teng Wen Gong 2": "Those who don't follow the way are like drilling holes." "Han Feizi. "Five beetles": "There are sages, who use sages to take fire to dissolve the fishy embarrassment, but the people say it makes the king the world, and the name is called the Suiren clan."

" Drill " means in-depth research and study. Such as "The Analects. "Zihan": "Look up to make the height, drill to make the firm." Xing Bingshu: "Drilling and seeking to gain strength." "Book of Later Han. "The Biography of Zheng Xuan": "He seeks the way of a gentleman, don't study it for another, be cautious and respectful, and be virtuous."

" Drill " means drill camp and climb. Such as "Selected Works. Ban Mengjian's "Xing Bin Opera": "Shang Yang uses three tricks to drill his filial piety, and Li Si fends on the current affairs and wants the first emperor." Su Shi of the Northern Song Dynasty "He Qian'an Dao to send Huijian tea": "Collecting and treating guests, not Dare to wrap the diamond right."

" Drilling " also means a torture tool for feint punishment. "Mandarin. "Lu Yu": "Saws are used for criminal punishment, followed by drills." Wei Zhao's note: "Drilling, punishment." It also means weapons such as spear blades and arrows, such as "Historical Records. "Book of Rites": "The giant iron stone of Wan, the drill is like a worm, light and sharp, and a soldier is like a wind." Sima Zhensuo Yin: "Drilling is a spear blade and a arrow."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " gold ", " Like " sound. The original meaning is a tool for perforation, which also means perforation and piercing.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「贊」聲。本義是穿孔的工具。《說文》：「鑽，所以穿也。从金，贊聲。」如〈急就篇〉「鐵鈇鑽錐釜鍑鍪」，顏師古注：「鑽，所以穿通也。」《說苑．正諫》：「泰山之溜穿石，引繩久之，乃以栔木。水非石之鑽，繩非木之鋸也，而漸靡使之然。」

　　「鑽」也表示穿孔、刺穿。《說文》段玉裁注：「本是器名，因之謂穿亦曰鑽。」如《孟子．滕文公下》：「不由其道而往者，與鑽穴隙之類也。」《韓非子．五蠹》：「有聖人作，鑽燧取火以化腥臊，而民說之，使王天下，號之曰燧人氏。」

　　「鑽」表示深入研究、鑽研。如《論語．子罕》：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。」邢昺疏：「鑽研求之則益堅。」《後漢書．鄭玄傳》：「其勗求君子之道，研鑽勿替，敬慎威儀，以近有德。」

　　「鑽」表示鑽營、攀附。如《文選．班孟堅〈荅賓戲〉一首》：「商鞅挾三術以鑽孝公，李斯奮時務而要始皇。」北宋蘇軾〈和錢安道寄惠建茶〉：「收藏愛惜待佳客，不敢包裹鑽權倖。」

　　「鑽」又表示臏刑的刑具。《國語．魯語》：「中刑用刀鋸，其次用鑽笮。」韋昭注：「鑽，臏刑。」亦表示矛刃、矢鏃之類的武器，如《史記．禮書》：「宛之鉅鐵施，鑽如蠭蠆，輕利剽遫，卒如熛風。」司馬貞索隱：「鑽謂矛刃及矢鏃也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「贊」聲。本義是穿孔的工具，又表示穿孔、刺穿。

Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right

    • 贊 [ zàn ] to help, to support; to laud, to praise
  • Pinyin: zuān

    English Definition: to drill; to bore; to get into; to make one's way into; to enter (a hole); to thread one's way through; to study intensively; to dig into; to curry favor for personal gain

    鑽空子 [ zuān kòng zi ]: lit. to drill a hole; to take advantage of a loophole; to exploit an advantage; to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)

從「 金 」，「 贊 」聲。本義是穿孔的工具。《說文》：「鑽，所以穿也。从金，贊聲。」如〈急就篇〉「鐵鈇鑽錐釜鍑鍪」，顏師古注：「鑽，所以穿通也。」《說苑．正諫》：「泰山之溜穿石，引繩久之，乃以栔木。水非石之鑽，繩非木之鋸也，而漸靡使之然。」 「 鑽 」也表示穿孔、刺穿。《說文》段玉裁注：「本是器名，因之謂穿亦曰鑽。」如《孟子．滕文公下》：「不由其道而往者，與鑽穴隙之類也。」《韓非子．五蠹》：「有聖人作，鑽燧取火以化腥臊，而民說之，使王天下，號之曰燧人氏。」 「 鑽 」表示深入研究、鑽研。如《論語．子罕》：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。」邢昺疏：「鑽研求之則益堅。」《後漢書．鄭玄傳》：「其勗求君子之道，研鑽勿替，敬慎威儀，以近有德。」 「 鑽 」表示鑽營、攀附。如《文選．班孟堅〈荅賓戲〉一首》：「商鞅挾三術以鑽孝公，李斯奮時務而要始皇。」北宋蘇軾〈和錢安道寄惠建茶〉：「收藏愛惜待佳客，不敢包裹鑽權倖。」 「 鑽 」又表示臏刑的刑具。《國語．魯語》：「中刑用刀鋸，其次用鑽笮。」韋昭注：「鑽，臏刑。」亦表示矛刃、矢鏃之類的武器，如《史記．禮書》：「宛之鉅鐵施，鑽如蠭蠆，輕利剽遫，卒如熛風。」司馬貞索隱：「鑽謂矛刃及矢鏃也。」

Positive Admonishment": "Taishan slips through the stone, and the rope is used for a long time. It is a wood. Water is not a stone for a drill, and a rope is not a saw for wood. " Drill" also means perforation and piercing. Duan Yucai's note in "Shuowen": "This is the name of a device, because it is called a diamond." For example, "Mencius. "Teng Wen Gong 2": "Those who don't follow the way are like drilling holes." "Han Feizi. 鑽字的基本解释

鑽
zuān

鑽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zuàn］
［《廣韻》子筭切，去换，精。］
“钻1”的繁体字。“鐉1”的被通假字。
(1)穿孔的工具。
(2)去髌的刑具。亦用作刑法名。
(3)取火的工具。
(4)金刚钻（钻石）的简称。
(5)赚，诳骗。
[②]［zuān］
［《廣韻》借官切，平桓，精。］
“钻2”的繁体字。亦作“鑚1”。
(1)穿孔，打眼。
(2)穿过；进入或突出。
(3)钻研。
(4)特指钻刺龟甲并以火灼以卜吉凶。
(5)钻营。
(6)指矛刃、矢镞。
(7)通“攢”。聚。
(8)通“劗”。剪。参见“鑽2髮”。

鑽字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鑽； 康熙笔画：27； 页码：页1327第27
【唐韻】借官切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】祖官切，?音劗。【說文】所以穿也。　又【前漢·?法志】其次用鑽鑿。【註】鑽，臏?也。師古曰：鑽，鑽去其臏骨也。　又【史記·禮書】施鑽如蠭蠆。【註】鑽，謂矛矢及鏃也。　又【正字通】金剛鑽生水底，如鐘乳，體似紫石英，惟安南高石山羚羊角能碎之。　又【廣韻】刺也。【爾雅·釋木】樝棃曰鑽之。【莊子·外物篇】神龜知能七十二鑽而無遺筴，不能避刳腸之患，如是則知有所困，神有所不及也。　又凡深入者，借用鑽。【論語】鑽之彌堅。【爾雅序】沈硏鑽極，二九載矣。又【班固·答賔戲】商鞅挾三術以鑽孝公。【註】帝王霸三策，鑽者，取必入之義。　又【廣韻】子算切【集韻】祖算切，?音䂎。義同。【六書故】去聲借貫切，穿器也。用之穿物曰鑽，平聲。【正字通】按以鑿鑿木皆讀昨，不聞鑿一音，鑿物又一音，鑽亦如之。必分平去二聲，泥。

鑽字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鑽字的起名意思

暂无。

Drill
Basic explanation of words
Drill
zuān
Drill
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zuàn］
["Guang Yun" Zi Yun cut, change, fine. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "钻1". "Milling 1" was passed falsely.
(1) Perforated tools.
(2) Instruments of torture to remove the patella. Also used as the name of the criminal law.
(3) Tools for making fire.
(4) Abbreviation for diamond (diamond).
(5) Earn, deceive.
[②]［zuān］
["Guang Yun" borrowed from the official cut, flat Huan, fine. ]
The traditional characters of "钻2". Also known as "鑚1".
(1) Piercing and punching.
(2) Pass through; enter or protrude.
(3) Research.
(4) Especially refers to the tortoise shell being drilled and pierced and burnt with fire to make a fortune.
(5) Drilling camp.
(6) Refers to the spear blade and arrowhead.
(7) Through "Save". Poly.
(8) Pass "劗". Cut. See "Drill 2 shots".
Drill
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Drill; Kangxi Strokes: 27; Page Number: Page 1327 27
[Tang Yun] Cut by the official [Jiyun] [Rhyme] [Zhengyun] Cut by the ancestor,? Sound. [Said Wen] So I wear it.　[Previous Han·Fazhi] Next, use a drill. [Note] Drill, pat? Also. Shi Gu said: Drill, drill off the patella.　[Historical Records·Book of Rites] Shizuanru Ru Jianqi. 【Note】Drilling means spear arrow and arrowhead.　[Zhengzitong] Diamond drilled underwater, like a stalactite, the body resembles amethyst, but the antelope horns of the Annan Gaoshishan can be broken.　[Guang Yun] thorn too. 【Erya·Shimu】Zhandi said Zhuanzhi. [Zhuangzi·Foreign Objects] The tortoise knows that it can do 72 diamonds without any loss, and cannot avoid the troubles of the intestines. If so, it knows that it is sleepy and that the gods are not enough.　For those who go deep, borrow a drill. [The Analects of Confucius] The drill is harder.
